_header: Men yearnen gestes for to hear / And romance read in diverse manner
Note: For a Prologue and 3 parts in some MSS, see 1155; for separate insertions, see 1285, 1687, 2931, 2945, 3092, 6363.

BodLauMis416.First Lines:
Men lykyn Iestis for to hereAnd romans rede in diuers
                    maner…
BodLauMis416.Last Lines:
…Our fadir make of alle thyngThat nevyr shalle haue
                    endyng
BodLauMis416.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth the boke of stories callid Cursor mundi (f. 66); Explicit
                    Cursor mundi (at the end)

BodFair14.First Lines:
MEn couettes rimes for to here& romance rede of mony
                    manerof alisaunder þe conquerourof Iuly cesar þe
                    emperour…
BodFair14.Last Lines:
…langage of þe norþern ledeþat can na
                    noþer langage rede
BodFair14.Attributed Title:
þis is þe best boke of alle / þe tours of þe werlde men
                    dos hit calle (f. 4ra)

CamTCC588.First Lines:
Men ȝernen iestes for to hereAnd romaunce rede in dyuerse
                    manereOf alisaunder þe conqueroureOf Iulius cesar þe
                    emperoure…
CamTCC588.Last Lines:
…Oure fadir maker of alle þingeÞat neuer shal haue
                    endynge
CamTCC588.Attributed Title:
Here bigynneþ þe boke of storyes þat men callen cursor mundi
                    (f. 1)

BLCottVesAIII.First Lines:
MAn yhernes rimes for to hereAnd romans red on maner
                    sere…
BLCottVesAIII.Last Lines:
…And steres his cristendame froAnd liuers him to þe find
                    his foo
BLCottVesAIII.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Cursor Mundi.
EETS
         o.s. 57 (1874); repr. 1961; 59 (1875); repr. 1966; 62 (1876); repr.
            1966; 66 (1877); repr. 1966; 68 (1878); repr. 1966; 101 (1893); repr. 1962: 8-1429.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 139-42 (extracts).

BLAdd31042.First Lines: …Sche was & that was sone appon hir senef[   ]godd hym selfe in hir he lighte…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …þat takes one hande þis begynnyngehe brynge me vn to gode endyng

BLAdd36983.First Lines:
Men ȝerneþ gestis forto hereAnd romance Rede in diuers
                    manere
BLAdd36983.Last Lines:
And sende vs grace þat day to RiseTo blis with þat trew
                    Iustis AMEN
BLAdd36983.Note: Omits lines 14916-17288 and ends at line 22004.
BLAdd36983.Attributed Title:
Explicit þe begynnyng off þe worlde off þe trenite þe
                    Fadir & Son & holigost þe Making off þe worlde & of adam
                    & Eve & afftir of Noye & So Fro noye to Abraham & So doune
                    þe Genelagy of our lady & þe birth off Crist & his pascion
                    & Resurrexion & So Many oþer dyuers maters & So to þe day
                    of dome & þe Comyng of antecrist & So to þe laste day of
                    Iugement (f. 174v)

CollArmsAr57.First Lines:
…Siþþe hit shal be rad ȝow þanneOf
                    ioachym and of seynt anne…
CollArmsAr57.Last Lines:
…Oure fadir maker of alle þingÞat neuer shcal haue
                    endyngA M E N
CollArmsAr57.Editions:
Horrall,  Sarah M.,
                        ed.  
             The Southern Version of Curson Mundi.
         Vol 1. Ottawa: University of Ottawa Press, 1978-2000.

Stafford.First Lines:
GOdde with blisfulle beldisÞat alle þis worlde with
                    wysdome woldisA[n]d alle þat whylum was bot noghtÞou has
                    vnto sere schapyng broghtAnd [ ] a man in to du[ ]lle…
Stafford.Last Lines:
…I trow in myghty god þat wroghtHeuen and erthe and alle
                    of noght
Stafford.Note:
Two binding fragments, portions of bifolia, top and bottom, by same
                    fifteenth-century hand; text beginning line 25684.

EDCPCM.First Lines:
…In heuin on heie þan sale I scaweAnd signis dune on
                    erþe lawe…
EDCPCM.Last Lines:
…Al þat þis bok or heris or redisLeuedi þaim
                    help in al þair nedis
EDCPCM.Note:
Fragment, misbound and imperfect at beginning and end(?), with two
                    folios missing between 45 and 46; lines 18989-23944.
EDCPCM.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Cursor Mundi.
EETS
         o.s. 57 (1874); repr. 1961; 59 (1875); repr. 1966; 62 (1876); repr.
            1966; 66 (1877); repr. 1966; 68 (1878); repr. 1966; 101 (1893); repr. 1962: 1587-1637.
Ross,  C. C. V.,
                        ed.  
             “An Edition of Part of the Edinburgh Fragment of the Cursor
                Mundi.” 
         Thesis. Oxford 1971.

GottingenTheo107.First Lines:
…n ȝernis iestis for to here[A]nd romance rede on
                    mansereOf alexander þe conquerourOr Iulius cesar þe
                    emperour…
GottingenTheo107.Last Lines:
…And qua it helis and haldis fra me treuli i ȝu
                    tellCurced in kirc þan sal þai be wid candil boke and
                    bell

McGill142.First Lines:
…To him hue clepede wiȝ rewlich [ ]To hire he sende an
                    aungel fram heueneAnd hire to gladie him self he camCrist þat of
                    hire flesch nam…
McGill142.Last Lines:
…Mi sone schal wel ȝelde it þeIch schal him bidde
                    wan ich him se…
